title: Monero GUI not linked with /DYNAMICBASE or hardening on windows, no ASLR

profile.name: Monero
profile.about: Monero: the secure, private, untraceable cryptocurrency

vulnerability_information:
**Summary:**
The monero daemon is compiled and linked without ASLR, at least on windows. This security hardening feature should be enabled in order to make exploiting of this service harder.

**Description:** 
See above. 

## Releases Affected:

  * At least v0.11.1.0 (probably more) / Tested on Windows 8.1

## Steps To Reproduce:

  1. Start the monero-gui and monero daemon on windows
  2. Start Process Explorer https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/process-explorer 
  3. Check ASLR under "select columns"
  4. See that ASLR is not activated for this process.

## Supporting Material/References:

  * I've attached a screenshot of the sysinternals tool on my machine.

## Impact

Exploiting code reuse attacks is alot easier without this feature. 
This might impact future bug bounty payouts because people can't exploit reliable bugs to get code execution :)
vulnerability_information_html:
Summary:
The monero daemon is compiled and linked without ASLR, at least on windows. This security hardening feature should be enabled in order to make exploiting of this service harder.

Description:
See above.

Releases Affected:

  • At least v0.11.1.0 (probably more) / Tested on Windows 8.1

Steps To Reproduce:

  1. Start the monero-gui and monero daemon on windows
  2. Start Process Explorer https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/downloads/process-explorer
  3. Check ASLR under "select columns"
  4. See that ASLR is not activated for this process.

Supporting Material/References:

  • I've attached a screenshot of the sysinternals tool on my machine.

Impact

Exploiting code reuse attacks is alot easier without this feature.
This might impact future bug bounty payouts because people can't exploit reliable bugs to get code execution :)

activities.message:
Hello @c4c1234757b4f1e468a29d480d78f2.

Thanks for the report. Not only do we [build monerod with dynamicbase](https://github.com/monero-project/monero/blob/master/CMakeLists.txt#L572), but we also ensure that other standard hardening options are used. These options are in the current master branch and will make it into the next release. As for the GUI, I have yet to confirm (ping @moneromooo).

Also note that Microsoft's ASLR doesn't protect users from Microsoft nor from Microsoft's ability to backdoor their own ASLR (or nearly anything else they produce for that matter). Also note their ASLR ["feature"](https://www.kb.cert.org/vuls/id/817544).

Regarding your screenshot, how are you building the binary / which binary are you using?

Also note that Microsoft's ASLR doesn't protect users from Microsoft nor from Microsoft's ability to backdoor their own ASLR (or nearly anything else they produce for that matter). Also note their ASLR "feature".

activities.message:
Note: I don't see any build hardening in the monero-gui https://github.com/monero-project/monero-gui/blob/master/monero-wallet-gui.pro.

@c4c1234757b4f1e468a29d480d78f2 can you provide any monerod/monero-gui exploits that would otherwise be mitigated with ASLR?

activities.message:
No I didn't build the master myself. I have only tested with the binary release on https://downloads.getmonero.org/gui/win64 . I was thinking this was the latest release. 

No I'm not aware of any monerod/monero-gui exploits.
activities.markdown_message:
No I didn't build the master myself. I have only tested with the binary release on https://downloads.getmonero.org/gui/win64 . I was thinking this was the latest release.

No I'm not aware of any monerod/monero-gui exploits.

activities.message:
As mentioned above, recent monerod uses ASLR, NX, PIE and -D_FORTIFY_SOURCE.
The GUI does not yet, this will be done soon. However, since the GUI only accesses the network when using a remote daemon or resolving openalias addresses, the attack surface is very much reduced.

To expand: the GUI will run the monerod binary to sync the blockchain and do general P2P comms. This is fully hardened. The GUI will access the network if it is set to use a remote daemon (not default). In this case, it will use the monero libraries, which are built with the hardening flags. This means most of the attack surface is hardened. However, the GUI specific C++ code is not yet hardened, and so this means it doesn't use things like ASLR. This code is mostly UI code though, so all the network code in shared libs is hardened.

Note that I don't use windows, so I have no idea whether my hardening flags are really fully working for Windows. They're pretty good on Linux.

The GUI does not yet, this will be done soon. However, since the GUI only accesses the network when using a remote daemon or resolving openalias addresses, the attack surface is very much reduced.

To expand: the GUI will run the monerod binary to sync the blockchain and do general P2P comms. This is fully hardened. The GUI will access the network if it is set to use a remote daemon (not default). In this case, it will use the monero libraries, which are built with the hardening flags. This means most of the attack surface is hardened. However, the GUI specific C++ code is not yet hardened, and so this means it doesn't use things like ASLR. This code is mostly UI code though, so all the network code in shared libs is hardened.

Note that I don't use windows, so I have no idea whether my hardening flags are really fully working for Windows. They're pretty good on Linux.

activities.message:
Ok, I've just build the master and checked that monerod is compiled with dynamicbase and run with ASLR on windows. (Although the current master fails to build and I had apply the changes from here https://github.com/monero-project/monero/issues/3296)
I also agree that the GUI is not as important as the daemon.

I also agree that the GUI is not as important as the daemon.

activities.message:
For the record, that conversation prodded me to finally rebuild a GUI VM and PR the hardening changes:
https://github.com/monero-project/monero-gui/pull/1150

activities.message:
@c4c1234757b4f1e468a29d480d78f2 This issue was resolved in https://github.com/monero-project/monero-gui/pull/1150 and will be included in our upcoming release.

If you are interested in receiving bounty, please paste a monero address into this ticket. The address can be temporary/one-time if needed.
